examples: a battalion of ants
a multitude of TV antennas
a plurality of religions

definitions.text: a complete collection of similar things
a convenient package or parcel (as of cigarettes or film)

examples: police tried to break up the gang
a pack of thieves

definitions.text: an exclusive circle of people with a common purpose
a cream that cleanses and tones the skin
a sheet or blanket (either dry or wet) to wrap around the body for its therapeutic effect
a bundle (especially one carried on the back)

examples: pack the books into the boxes
This singer always packs the concert halls
The murder trial packed the court house
wad paper into the box
Pack your tents to the top of the mountain

definitions.text: set up a committee or legislative body with one's own supporters so as to influence the outcome
examples: pack a jury

definitions.text: have with oneself; have on one's person
examples: She always takes an umbrella
I always carry money
She packs a gun when she goes into the mountains
The crowd packed the auditorium
Every summer they are backpacking in the Rockies
tamp the coffee grinds in the container to make espresso
pack the faucet

definitions.text: have the property of being packable or of compacting easily
examples: This powder compacts easily
Such odd-shaped items do not pack well

definitions.text: treat the body or any part of it by wrapping it, as with blankets or sheets, and applying compresses to it, or stuffing it to provide cover, containment, or therapy, or to absorb blood
examples: The nurse packed gauze in the wound
You had better pack your swollen ankle with ice
